column5: Thursday and Friday I was working on a new ice fishing project. I wanted a portable hut but spent that money on a sonar/gps for the boat   So I decided to make one.  Building a hut is easy enough but I wanted to be able to fold it down and carry it on my ATV   So I came up with a plan of making a light frame that would have all the pieces fold out to hold itself together. I was going to just make a tarp cover for it but I rolled into Princess auto and found a replacement tent cover for $10    Now I didn't have to worry about a door or windows  So anyways since it cost a whole $15 to build I wasn't too concerned if it didn't work. I tested it out on LPB on Saturday and it actually worked    Took 5 minutes to set up, blocked the wind and kept us warm.          As for the fishing we caught a bunch of perch, only a few good size but still a lot of fun  First fish was a monster lol            This was the site first thing in the morning.      In the afternoon I noticed that the wind picked up a bit and opened the door to have a look. Well I could barely see the ATV because of the whiteout   It's a good thing I had my compass because that's how we got back in. That was followed by a 3 hour drive home that was pretty scary in some spots.
Can't beat the price Dan !!! And some little fishies to boot!
Good job, Dan. UMMM, I have a crick in my neck from looking at that tent.
Nice perch bud, the shelter looks pretty decent, how far down the hole could you see?  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
Nice Dan, keeps the elements at bay, anyways.  Plus you will probably get a lot more use out of the sonar/gps!
For sure Frankie  Mike - I could see bottom no problem
Yeah, most place in LPB, I could stand on bottom and the top of my head, would be at the hole.

hey Dan I think you passed me when we were walking back in mu portable hut looks like a big green tent it's a 10x10 from pinical (spelt wrong but oh well) I just wish I had a way out and in other than feet or the taxi maybe next year
Great report Dan, but..   That is the result 90% of the time, on a good day out there.. can't believe you'd waste your time on the bay but I guess to each his own. lol

I honestly couldn't see a damn thing coming back in, I'll have a look for you next time   It's a convenience thing Rich, I wanna check out the cottage and boat house so I might as well fish while I'm there. I still wanna hit your honey holes this year!
